name: Tacos al Pastor
description: Marinated pork cooked on a vertical spit, sliced and served on tortillas with pineapple and onion.
instructions: Combine achiote paste, pineapple juice, vinegar, oregano, cumin, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and salt in a bowl.
Add sliced pork and marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Thread marinated pork onto a vertical spit and cook until browned and crispy.
Slice cooked pork into small pieces and serve on tortillas with diced pineapple and onion.

name: Enchiladas Verdes
description: Rolled tortillas filled with chicken, covered in green salsa and topped with cheese.
instructions: Warm tortillas in the oven or microwave until soft.
In a bowl, mix shredded chicken with 1 cup of salsa verde.
Spoon chicken mixture onto each tortilla and roll up.
Place rolled tortillas in a baking dish, seam side down.
Pour remaining salsa verde over the tortillas and sprinkle with cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with sour cream, cilantro, salt and pepper before serving.
